cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles south of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north toward Haiti, forecast to pass over eastern Cuba then turn north-northwest through the Bahamas and track just off the southeast U.S. coast toward the Carolinas late this week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida east coast near Cape Canaveral (first U.S. landfall) before brushing the South Carolina/North Carolina coasts

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline yet (only Caribbean islands at this advisory)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline yet (only Caribbean islands at this advisory)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through North Carolina, including Wilmington area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) have a 30 % cumulative chance with peak onset probability of 12 % around 96 h; 50-kt winds have an 11 % cumulative chance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks close to the coast, a surge of 2–4 ft above ground level is possible in the Cape Fear region including Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainbands could produce 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents and coastal flooding will begin well before closest approach; port operations may also be affected by upstream river flooding.
